blog.name: thedemonphanti
blog.title: thedemonphanti
blog.description: Treat People With Respect | Unpopular Opinions Welcome

summary: Do you agree with the following statment? Phil is better than Dan at managing his own mind, emotions, thoughts, and feelings.
question: Do you agree with the following statment? Phil is better than Dan at managing his own mind, emotions, thoughts, and feelings.
answer: No, I don’t agree actually. They are very different people and have different strengths and weaknesses, but I wouldn’t say one way is inherently better than the other. Phil is much better at compartmentalizing, whereas Dan tends to let things consume him, and I think that’s why it might seem like he is better at managing his mind and emotions than Dan, but he is also not very comfortable sharing anything that isn’t positive and agreeable and isn’t able to push himself out of his comfort zone or give up control nearly as easily as Dan. Phil tends to avoid “negative” emotions, whereas Dan tends to lean into them. One example of this is Phil saying that he was too sensitive to watch The Handmaid’s Tale. The show is pretty harrowing, but it’s no more violent or graphic sexually than Game of Thrones, which he loves. The reason The Handmaid’s Tale is uncomfortable to watch at times is because it forces us to confront things about our own society and where we could end up if they are allowed to go unchecked. I actually think their philosophies when it comes to playing video games, as seen on the gaming channel, demonstrate their differences pretty well. When a game is difficult and frustrating, Phils reaction more often than not seems to be to give up and move onto something else, whereas Dan tends to get more determined and committed. Dan’s philosophy is more likely to lead to progress and achievement, but also more likely to drive him crazy in the process. I don’t think either way is better, just different.

blog.name: thedemonphanti
blog.title: thedemonphanti
blog.description: Treat People With Respect | Unpopular Opinions Welcome

summary: When do you think Dan will start making videos again, or at least come out of hiding?
question: When do you think Dan will start making videos again, or at least come out of hiding?
answer:
This is a really hard question for me to answer because, since I don’t know what Dan is up to, I don’t really have any information to serve as the basis for speculation. People have a lot of theories about why Dan is absent from social media, but I always end up going back to what he said in the mukbang video about going through a period of personal growth and that he feels that he needs to do that on his own, without sharing it, in order to do it effectively.

When I was studying psychology, I learned a lot about how damaging judgement, even positive judgement, can be and if you think about it, Dan has spent his entire adult life being in an environment where he has been judged and either rewarded handsomely or punished harshly for almost everything he’s done, socially and monitarily. He has learned how to act in a way that he knows will get attention and approval and, going back to the mukbang, that’s why it really made me a bit sad for him when he spoke about feeling like he doesn’t have a personality, because it must be confusing to wonder if you are doing things because you actually want to or because you like the feeling that you get from clicks and likes and views (and money) on social media (it can be for me and I’m not even famous).

Dan has never really had a chance to explore who he wants to be without us there praising or condemning him and I think, at least I hope, that maybe he didn’t expect his break from social media to last this long, but is enjoying going through the process of getting to know himself without us standing over his shoulders hoping and praying that he makes choices in line with who we want him to be. That’s a lot of pressure. For example, it a small thing, but it has always made me uncomfortable how much people push Dan to wear nail polish because I could never tell if it’s something he actually wanted to be doing or if it’s something he is doing to make others happy. On the other hand, I watched the Danmails again recently and saw how genuinely excited he was to get his iconic llama hat. He said that he had always wanted one, but didn’t think he should have one since he was a boy, but was going to wear it because someone sent it to him and he liked it. If Dan does come back, I really hope to see more of him being really excited to express himself as he is and people being supportive of that.

I don’t know how long it will take him to get to that point, but he did spend the last couple of years catering to who people wanted him to be and even acted it out on tour. I think he more than deserves to get to be who he wants to be now and, as much as I’d miss him, if he decides that he will never be able to do that continuing on YouTube or as a public figure, I will support that because it is his life and he only gets one and he needs to make himself happy, not us. Personally, I just try not to really have any expectations for him to come back, so that way I’m not disappointed. I hope he does though!
